topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a19ffa6368721f820000d5#post_55a19ffa6368721f820000d5
What, the [spoiler]brain transfer[/spoiler] stuff?
The first I think was a good plot point. The second one was pushing it. The third one at the very end was pretty dumb. 

Also the fact that they have a guy that can [spoiler]create a sentient being which in turn figures out how to transfer consciousness into a machine and they're like "kill it because reasons!"[/spoiler] is also pretty dumb

I kinda just consider neill blomkamp movies to be B movies with amazing special effects because there's almost always dumb crap

topics.body:
"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a1a1646368721f35000279#post_55a1a1646368721f35000279
yeah id say so, its like 20 years after the aliens land and they just give up on them, like a few investigations took place during that but thats all. i honestly call bullshit on that one, like seriously how many years have we been staring at molecules and out into outer space? literally like hundreds of years weve been wondering about life outside of earth and we just gave up on the aliens thats so dumb and unrealistic. the worst thing about this is that theyre doing that just for the sake of hammering in their overly pretentious and obvious symbolism, which is so obviously about prejudice in our society, which GEE WE TOTALLY HAVE NEVER SEEN THAT IN FILM BEFORE.

i really hated the movie

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a1a2896368721f22000448#post_55a1a2896368721f22000448

I meant the one at the end. [spoiler]He was shot in the fucking stomach! Chappi has an internet's worth of knowledge in his head and he thinks a risky, complicated, and possible hopeless brain transfer is better than a goddamn hospital?[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Not to mention that the profanity was just...unnecessary. I have nothing against vulgar language, but they were trying _so hard_ to make their Caucasian ass gangsters seem threatening that it had just the opposite effect.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]But above all, the fact that Chappie's "dad" got away with being an abusive _asshole_ to something that was described as a child, even taking advantage of him at every single turn he could, just because "aww he cares that his girlfriend was killed" was reprehensible.[/spoiler]
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442
